Unstable Column (1-2).description: Plaster crumbles from this column moments before it collapses.
Unstable Column (1-2).hazardDisable: @Check[crafting|dc:16] (trained) to stabilize the column, @Check[athletics|dc:19] to push the column back into place
Unstable Column (1-2).name: Unstable Column (1-2)

Unstable Column (3-4).description: Plaster crumbles from this column moments before it collapses.
Unstable Column (3-4).hazardDisable: @Check[crafting|dc:18] (trained) to stabilize the column, @Check[athletics|dc:21] to push the column back into place
Unstable Column (3-4).name: Unstable Column (3-4)

Unstable Column (5-6).description: Plaster crumbles from this column moments before it collapses.
Unstable Column (5-6).hazardDisable: @Check[crafting|dc:22] (trained) to stabilize the column, @Check[athletics|dc:25] to push the column back into place
Unstable Column (5-6).name: Unstable Column (5-6)

Unstable Skeletal Champion.description:
These skeletons retain the cunning they possessed in life.

Made from bones held together by foul necromancy, skeletons are among the most common types of undead, found haunting old dungeons and forgotten cemeteries.

1bBC3gSU3ECsoCQQ.description:
When the skeleton is destroyed, its bones shatter and explode as the necromantic energy holding it together is released.

Adjacent creatures take @Damage[1d6[slashing]] damage with a @Check[reflex|dc:15|basic] save.
1bBC3gSU3ECsoCQQ.name: Explosive Death

4mxVP2iXudQgPUAn.description: Longswords can be one-edged or two-edged swords. Their blades are heavy and they're between 3 and 4 feet in length.
4mxVP2iXudQgPUAn.name: Longsword

Unstable Skeletal Champion.name: Unstable Skeletal Champion

Unstable Skeleton Guard.description:
The most common skeletal minions are mere guardians.

Made from bones held together by foul necromancy, skeletons are among the most common types of undead, found haunting old dungeons and forgotten cemeteries.

pizMKND03JPq2YUH.description:
When the skeleton is destroyed, its bones shatter and explode as the necromantic energy holding it together is released.

Adjacent creatures take @Damage[1d6[slashing]] damage with a @Check[reflex|dc:13|basic] save.
pizMKND03JPq2YUH.name: Explosive Death

Unstable Skeleton Guard.name: Unstable Skeleton Guard

0Z0tfKCoRaKagvVT.description:
The bosun Strikes with their naval pike.

If this Strike hits, the bosun can either move the target 5 feet within the pike's reach or make a fist Strike against the target without increasing their multiple attack penalty until after the fist Strike.
0Z0tfKCoRaKagvVT.name: Pike and Strike

ioBhBqoLt4XX6CZA.description: A long metal shaft ending with a metal spike, a spear can be used one-handed as a melee weapon and can be thrown.
ioBhBqoLt4XX6CZA.name: Naval Pike

u6QEft9DxfittKI2.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect The bosun orders an ally to attack or to get in position. Until the end of the ally's next turn, they gain the bosun's choice of a +2 status bonus to attack rolls or a +10-foot status bonus to their Speeds.

  • @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.WfiaKdXNSxC3POcs]{Effect: Bosun's Command - Attack Bonus}
  • @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.yG27Ixwdpxqbrhzf]{Effect: Bosun's Command - Speed Bonus}
u6QEft9DxfittKI2.name: Bosun's Command

cHWzyBoiaRRRBq99.name: +2 to Will Saves vs. Higher Ranking Iron Ring Members

zMkrKhyfRWFrFfuv.description:
Requirements The fanatic has taken damage and is neither @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued} nor already in a frenzy

Effect The cultist flies into a frenzy that lasts 1 minute. While frenzied, the cultist gains a +1 status bonus to attack rolls and a +2 status bonus to damage rolls, and they take a -2 status penalty to AC. The cultist can't voluntarily stop their frenzy. After their frenzy, the cultist is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued}.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.3Wtzyb0ZgkaC7vHY]{Effect: Fanatical Frenzy}
zMkrKhyfRWFrFfuv.name: Fanatical Frenzy

Vengeful Ember Fox.description: Ember foxes resemble their canid namesakes, save for the flames that make their fur and the tips of their long whiskers flicker and glow.

JlQUb1sbsYfmz5Vi.description:
Trigger An adjacent ally is targeted by an effect that deals fire damage

Effect The ember fox drapes itself across its ally, granting the ally fire resistance 10 against the incoming attack.
JlQUb1sbsYfmz5Vi.name: Cloak in Embers

Vengeful Ember Fox.name: Vengeful Ember Fox

jiwaCzUFH8bHPQsZ.description: @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened} creatures are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} to the Onyx Alliance enforcer.
jiwaCzUFH8bHPQsZ.name: Dread Striker

uRQUbYaddKHdfNtE.description: Effect The Onyx Alliance enforcer makes a melee Strike. If the attack hits, the enforcer Strides. If the enforcer ends this movement in dim light or darkness, they can attempt to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.action-macros.Macro.FlM3HvpnsZpCKawG]{Hide: Stealth}.
uRQUbYaddKHdfNtE.name: Shadow Swipe

z1RwdJaIvbznXF0a.description: When the Onyx Alliance enforcer rolls initiative using Deception or Stealth, they can attempt to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.2u915NdUyQan6uKF]{Demoralize} one creature as a free action.
z1RwdJaIvbznXF0a.name: Shadowy Ambush

Veteran Onyx Alliance Scout.description:
The people known today as fetchlings are a distinct ancestry descended from generations of humans who became trapped ages ago on the Shadow Plane. No longer human at all, these people, who call themselves kayals, have become monochromatic in coloration, with flesh tones and hair colors varying between white, black, and all shades of gray. Their limbs are lithe and willowy, and their eyes are generally solid yellow, yellow-green, or white, though a rare few have a purple or blue glow.

Fetchlings have developed their own complex societies in the Shadow Plane, often under the tolerance of or in servitude to the strange, malignant creatures there, such as the sinister velstracs or the enigmatic d'ziriaks. While individual fetchlings can be any alignment, they are all survivors in a harsh environment, which leads to a tendency toward pragmatism. Fetchling clothing mimics the regions they dwell in, with drab colors tending toward darker shades. When they trade with humans or other societies on the Material Plane, they often wear masks or concealing clothing to hide their appearance.

Typical fetchling communities are insular and swiftly close ranks in the event of an intruder. Though individual fetchlings don't mind traveling to and blending in with other societies to facilitate trade, they often hide or even react defensively if they have their own visitors. When one considers the nature of the other denizens of the Shadow Plane, however, this tendency to assume the worst of interlopers might make sense to some.

Fetchlings are not as common on the Material Plane; most of those who dwell there are loners by choice who have left their home to seek out adventure elsewhere, exiles who were banished from their homelands, or planar castaways with no ability to return to the Shadow Plane. This last category, the lost and stranded, are the most likely to be found in larger groups. In cities of significant size, one can sometimes even find a small community of a few dozen or more fetchlings living among humans, although they often do so subtly by dyeing their hair, wearing brightly colored clothing, and utilizing layers of makeup to hide their pallid complexions.

7oSwnJxN4kTQ4qO0.description: The fetchling scout's Strikes deal an additional 1d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.
7oSwnJxN4kTQ4qO0.name: Sneak Attack

F9bWb4eSF5QIBze0.description:
Requirements The fetchling is in dim light

Effect The fetchling Strides. They have a +10-foot status bonus to their Speed during this Stride. The DC from shadow blending increases to 11 during this Stride, and the fetchling remains @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} by dim light until the end of the movement, even if they leave dim light during the Stride.
F9bWb4eSF5QIBze0.name: Shadow Stride

P6oJVM0MDCy82QgU.description: When the fetchling scout is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} as a result of dim light, the flat check to target them has a DC of 7, not 5.
P6oJVM0MDCy82QgU.name: Shadow Blending

TNfduKabCjNGvHGp.description:
You create an illusion that causes you to appear as another creature of the same body shape, and with roughly similar height (within 6 inches) and weight (within 50 pounds), as yourself. The disguise is typically good enough to hide your identity, but not to impersonate a specific individual. The spell doesn't change your voice, scent, or mannerisms. You can change the appearance of your clothing and worn items, such as making your armor look like a dress. Held items are unaffected, and any worn item you remove returns to its true appearance.

Casting illusory disguise counts as setting up a disguise for the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.action-macros.Macro.k5nW4jGyXD0Oq9LR]{Impersonate} use of Deception; it ignores any circumstance penalties you might take for disguising yourself as a dissimilar creature, it gives you a +4 status bonus to Deception checks to prevent others from seeing through your disguise, and you add your level even if you're untrained. You can Dismiss this spell.

Heightened (2nd) The spell also disguises your voice and scent, and it gains the auditory trait.

Heightened (3rd) You can appear as any creature of the same size, even a specific individual. You must have seen an individual to take on their appearance. The spell also disguises your voice and scent, and it gains the auditory trait.
TNfduKabCjNGvHGp.name: Illusory Disguise

Veteran Onyx Alliance Scout.name: Veteran Onyx Alliance Scout

Void Boils.description: Tumor-like growths erupt from the isle as it responds to psychic attack, spewing black lightning and fire in every direction.
Void Boils.hazardDisable: @Check[occultism|dc:26|name:Reshape the Dream] (trained) to reshape the substance of the dream, or @Check[performance|dc:30|name:Invoke Desna's Blessing] (trained) or @Check[religion|dc:28|name:Invoke Desna's Blessing] (trained) to invoke Desna's blessing through hymns or prayers. Each check to disable the hazard is a two-action activity; two total successes are required to disable the hazard.
Void Boils.hazardRoutine: (1 action) On the hazard's initiative, a boil erupts from the ground and bursts. This blast strikes as many enemies as possible in a @Template[burst|distance:15] anywhere on the isle, dealing @Damage[4d8[force]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:24|basic] or @Check[will|dc:24|basic], target's choice) to enemies in the area. Aslynn avoids targeting the nightmares with the blast.
Void Boils.name: Void Boils

Volatile Tidal Controls.description: Sigils carved into the turquoise sphere atop the altar illuminate. Moments later, a rush of water flows into the hallway.
Volatile Tidal Controls.hazardDisable: @Check[nature|dc:23] (trained) to neutralize the tidal magic, or @Check[survival|dc:26] to predict the changing tides, or @Check[thievery|dc:26] (trained) to scratch away the sigils; two total successes are required to disable the trap.
Volatile Tidal Controls.hazardRoutine:
(1 action) The magic controlling the tides malfunctions, causing the tides to change every few seconds. Water flows rapidly between areas B2 and B4. Each creature in area B2, area B4, or the hallway connecting them must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:22|traits:damaging-effect] save as the shifting tides buffet them, dealing @Damage[(2d8+5)[bludgeoning]] damage.

Critical Success The creature takes no damage.

Success The creature takes half damage.

Failure The creature takes full damage and is moved 10 feet along with the water.

Critical Failure The creature takes full damage and is moved 20 feet along with the water.
Volatile Tidal Controls.name: Volatile Tidal Controls

L6hJgZT4NqkSUMxv.description: When a ghost is destroyed, it re-forms after [[/br 2d4 #days]]{2d4 days} within the location it's bound to, fully healed. A ghost can be permanently destroyed only if someone determines the reason for its existence and sets right whatever prevents the spirit from resting.
L6hJgZT4NqkSUMxv.name: Rejuvenation

PR5hSXPywNZpzu3V.description:
The wailing ghost is bound to the labyrinth and can't stray from its location.

A typical ghost can stray only a short distance from where it was killed or the place it haunts. A typical limit is 120 feet. Some ghosts are instead bound to a room, building, item, or creature that was special to it rather than a location.
PR5hSXPywNZpzu3V.name: Site Bound

j8fomYONNBOihUb8.description: The wailing ghost shakes with a terrible sob, forcing each living creature within @Template[emanation|distance:15]{15 feet} to attempt a @Check[will|dc:18] save. On a failure, a creature becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1} (or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2} on a critical failure). On a success, a creature is temporarily immune to this ghost's Weeping Moan for 1 minute.
j8fomYONNBOihUb8.name: Weeping Moan

Waking Nightmare.description: Faceless statues struggle against each other to stay above the black dust.
Waking Nightmare.hazardDisable: @Check[diplomacy|dc:24|name:Convince the Statues] (expert) to urge the statues to work together, @Check[intimidation|dc:27|traits:action:coerce|name:Coerce the Statues] (expert) to Coerce the statues away, or @Check[occultism|dc:30|name:Oppose Psychic Influence] (trained) to oppose the psychic influence. Each check to disable the haunt is a two-action activity; three total successes are required to disable the haunt.
Waking Nightmare.hazardReset: The haunt deactivates 1 minute after all creatures leave the area but resets immediately thereafter.
Waking Nightmare.hazardRoutine: (1 action) On the haunt's initiative, creatures in the area sink deeper into the dust as statues grasp at them. Creatures in the area take @Damage[(2d10+9)[mental]]{2d10+9 mental damage} (@Check[will|dc:25|basic] saving throw). On a critical failure, the creature is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Confused} for 1 round. Creatures @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} by the haunt take a -1 circumstance penalty to their saving throw.
Waking Nightmare.name: Waking Nightmare

Waking Terror.description: Faceless statues struggle against each other to stay above the black dust.
Waking Terror.hazardDisable: @Check[diplomacy|dc:27|name:Convince the Statues] (expert) to urge the statues to work together, @Check[intimidation|dc:30|traits:action:coerce|name:Coerce the Statues] (expert) to Coerce the statues away, or @Check[occultism|dc:33|name:Oppose Psychic Influence] (trained) to oppose the psychic influence. Each check to disable the haunt is a two-action activity; three total successes are required to disable the haunt.
Waking Terror.hazardReset: The haunt deactivates 1 minute after all creatures leave the area but resets immediately thereafter.
Waking Terror.hazardRoutine: (1 action) On the haunt's initiative, creatures in the area sink deeper into the dust as statues grasp at them. Creatures in the area take @Damage[(2d10+13)[mental]]{2d10+13 mental damage} (@Check[will|dc:28|basic] saving throw). On a critical failure, the creature is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Confused} for 1 round. Creatures @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} by the haunt take a -1 circumstance penalty to their saving throw.
Waking Terror.name: Waking Terror

Wasp Swarm (Arctic).description:
The monsters are acclimated to the wintery climate of northern Arcadia.

Wasp nests are made of chewed wood fibers foraged from the surrounding flora, which the wasps make into a material similar to paper. A single wasp nest can house thousands of individuals that emerge as a massive swarm. Most swarms attack only to protect their nest or if otherwise agitated, though druids and other primal enchanters can bend these venomous vermin to their will-to deadly effect.

While the common wasp poses little threat to a hardy adventurer aside from an uncomfortable sting, a large and aggressive swarm of these territorial insects-to say nothing of their oversized kin-can lay low an entire party of heroes. The wasps represented here are of the common variety also known as yellowjackets, but many other sorts of dangerous wasps exist, such as a Garundi variant that swarms in such great numbers that it can decimate entire villages, and the dreaded extraplanar hellwasps, which build their nests within the corpses of their victims.

OwDiH7gzfhf1i4hu.description:
Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:21]

Maximum Duration 6 rounds

Stage 1 @Damage[1d6[poison]] (1 round)

Stage 2 @Damage[2d6[poison]] and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2} (2 rounds)
OwDiH7gzfhf1i4hu.name: Wasp Venom

z8Vh23jCIh7iroYs.description: Each enemy in the swarm's space takes @Damage[2d8[piercing]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:21|basic] save) and is exposed to wasp venom. A successful save negates the poison exposure.
z8Vh23jCIh7iroYs.name: Swarming Stings

Wasp Swarm (Arctic).name: Wasp Swarm (Arctic)

Wasp Swarm (Heretical).description:
The monsters have a visceral hatred of good deities and their servants, particularly Arcadia's benevolent couatls.

Wasp nests are made of chewed wood fibers foraged from the surrounding flora, which the wasps make into a material similar to paper. A single wasp nest can house thousands of individuals that emerge as a massive swarm. Most swarms attack only to protect their nest or if otherwise agitated, though druids and other primal enchanters can bend these venomous vermin to their will-to deadly effect.

While the common wasp poses little threat to a hardy adventurer aside from an uncomfortable sting, a large and aggressive swarm of these territorial insects-to say nothing of their oversized kin-can lay low an entire party of heroes. The wasps represented here are of the common variety also known as yellowjackets, but many other sorts of dangerous wasps exist, such as a Garundi variant that swarms in such great numbers that it can decimate entire villages, and the dreaded extraplanar hellwasps, which build their nests within the corpses of their victims.

Weak Hell Hound (PFS 3-07).description: A hell hound's appearance dismisses any doubts as to its infernal origins-flesh the color of burning pitch, teeth as sharp as any fiend's pitchfork, and a shroud of ever-burning hellfire are all trademark features.

GsQeeSV97T6FPvoY.description:
The hell hound breathes flames that deal @Damage[3d6[fire]] damage to all creatures in a @Template[cone|distance:15] (@Check[reflex|dc:17|basic] save).

The hell hound can't use Breath Weapon again for [[/br 1d4 #Recharge Breath Weapon]]{1d4 rounds}. If the hell hound would take fire damage or be targeted by a fire effect, its Breath Weapon recharges.
GsQeeSV97T6FPvoY.name: Breath Weapon

Weak Hell Hound (PFS 3-07).name: Weak Hell Hound (PFS 3-07)

Weakened Cobbleswarm.description:
Busy road builders might unknowingly use cobble mites in construction.

Cobble mites resemble squarish stones a few inches across with mouths like split geodes. Though indolent and harmless alone, they're dangerous in large groups.

MdAaSnMbM5KOAlWl.description: Each foe in the cobbleswarm's space takes @Damage[2d4[bludgeoning]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:17|basic] save).
MdAaSnMbM5KOAlWl.name: Pummeling Assault

NaTbdbqoxFlKljoH.description:
A cobbleswarm's tremorsense is a precise sense out to 40 feet and an imprecise sense out to 80 feet. A cobbleswarm can't sense anything beyond the range of its tremorsense.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.Tremorsense]
NaTbdbqoxFlKljoH.name: Tremorsense (Precise) 40 feet, (Imprecise) 80 feet

deXYiHJyBjDSNFF5.description:
The cobbleswarm attempts an @Check[athletics] check and compares the result to the Fortitude DC of each creature in its space. This counts as two attacks for the cobbleswarm's multiple attack penalty.

Critical Success The creature falls @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}, takes @Damage[1d6[bludgeoning]] damage, and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} by the cobbleswarm until the end of the cobbleswarm's next turn.

Success The creature falls prone.
deXYiHJyBjDSNFF5.name: Grasping Bites

Weakened Cobbleswarm.name: Weakened Cobbleswarm

Weeping Carved Mourner.description: The carving weeps. Its tears turn to a mist that covers the halls.
Weeping Carved Mourner.hazardDisable: @Check[religion|dc:20] (trained) to recite prayers for the dead, or @Check[dwarven-lore|dc:17] to speak the history of Raseri Kanton, or @Check[thievery|dc:23] to plug the holes in the carving
Weeping Carved Mourner.hazardReset: The trap resets whenever a creature enters the Labyrinth for the first time.
Weeping Carved Mourner.name: Weeping Carved Mourner

Werebat (PFS 3-13).description:
Werecreatures are humanoids who transform into animals and animal-humanoid hybrids under the light of the full moon. The fate of these shapechanging creatures derives from an ancient primal curse that they can, in turn, transmit through their own bites. The stat blocks in this section reflect werecreatures in their hybrid forms.

Werebats form organized colonies of opportunistic hunters. They aren't shy about transforming creatures to add to their colony, whom they initiate with elaborate social ceremonies and bloody hazing. The curse of the werebat gives them a strong urge to prey upon on weaker, lonely creatures. True werebats are often unusually tall and thin, with angular features. In combat, werebats favor their unarmed attacks because they can't fly while wielding weapons in their wings.

99nUjZasQrCxstqT.description:
This curse affects only humanoids

Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:15] DC.

On each full moon, the cursed creature must succeed at another Fortitude save or turn into a werebat until dawn. The creature is under the GM's control and goes on a rampage for half the night before falling unconscious until dawn.
99nUjZasQrCxstqT.name: Curse of the Werebat

Ajojy1WGpQvGA4Qr.description: Human with Fist attack for @Damage[(1d4+2)[bludgeoning]] damage and no fly Speed. In hybrid form, their Speed changes to 25 feet and fly 25 feet.
Ajojy1WGpQvGA4Qr.name: Change Shape

N684AMjLHsC12mwU.description: When a full moon appears in the night sky, the werebat must enter hybrid form and can't Change Shape thereafter. When the moon sets or the sun rises, the werebat returns to human form and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued} for [[/br 2d4 #Fatigued duration]]{2d4 hours}.
N684AMjLHsC12mwU.name: Moon Frenzy

Rmxe7dutW3AoDW4m.description: A werebat can use their hearing as a precise sense at the listed range.
Rmxe7dutW3AoDW4m.name: Echolocation (Precise) 40 feet

lnftcCa5nWLimB4r.description:
Trigger An adjacent enemy damages the werebat

Effect The werebat makes one or two wing Strikes, each against a different adjacent creature.
lnftcCa5nWLimB4r.name: Wing Thrash

Werebat (PFS 3-13).name: Werebat (PFS 3-13)

Weretiger (PFS 3-13).description:
These ferocious werecreatures stalk prey with the cunning and skill of a true apex predator. Weretigers typically view all life as a potential meal. Powerful nocturnal hunters with excellent senses that help them ambush prey, weretigers are adaptable to an extreme range of environments. However, weretigers living in densely populated cities (potentially as courtesans, assassins, or guild leaders) often struggle to suppress their killer instincts, becoming overwhelmed by the urge to hunt. They prefer to wear loose-fitting clothing and rely on their claws and jaws in a fight.

Werecreatures transform into animals and animal-humanoid hybrids under the light of the full moon. The doomed fate of these shapechanging creatures derives from an ancient primal curse that they can, in turn, transmit through their own bites. The stat blocks in this section reflect werecreatures in their hybrid forms.

0ZoLEnWUhbvvE24G.description: The weretiger makes a claw Strike against a creature it is grabbing. If the attack hits, that creature is knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}. A weretiger can only use this ability in animal form.
0ZoLEnWUhbvvE24G.name: Wrestle

3IQSdTZPneapXwVf.description:
The weretiger changes into their animal, human, or hybrid shape; they are presented in their animal shape. Each shape has a specific, persistent appearance.

In human or hybrid form, the weretiger's size changes to Medium, they lose their Wrestle ability, and their speed decreases to 25 feet. In human form, they also lose their jaws and claw Strikes and gain a melee fist Strike ([[/r {1d20+14} #fist attack]]{+14} for @Damage[(1d4+7)[bludgeoning]] damage).

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]
3IQSdTZPneapXwVf.name: Change Shape

AKOKPl5zfFti3EZh.description: When a full moon appears in the night sky, the weretiger must enter hybrid form and can't Change Shape thereafter. When the moon sets or the sun rises, the weretiger returns to humanoid form and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued} for [[/br 2d4 #Fatigued duration]]{2d4 hours}.
AKOKPl5zfFti3EZh.name: Moon Frenzy

RCjZk0ilv6kHRuT5.description:
This curse affects only humanoids

Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:21].

On each full moon, the cursed creature must succeed at another Fortitude save or turn into the same kind of werecreature until dawn. The creature is under the GM's control and goes on a rampage for half the night before falling unconscious until dawn.
RCjZk0ilv6kHRuT5.name: Curse of the Weretiger

Weretiger (PFS 3-13).name: Weretiger (PFS 3-13)

5cf5c4QvVxAQ2DpC.description: The young arabuk Strides and makes a Strike at the end of that movement. If the arabuk began this action @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden}, it remains hidden until after this ability's Strike.
5cf5c4QvVxAQ2DpC.name: Pounce

CIlpwcNVlRkSNhWx.description: Snow doesn't impair an arabuk's vision; it ignores concealment from snowfall.
CIlpwcNVlRkSNhWx.name: Snow Vision

EoPnAhoSpqgOXqgu.description: The young arabuk reduces the effects it suffers from cold environments by one step.
EoPnAhoSpqgOXqgu.name: Cold Adaptation

pEBPYHWxT2jukxE7.description: The young arabuk ignores difficult terrain, greater difficult terrain, and uneven ground from non-magical ice and snow.
pEBPYHWxT2jukxE7.name: Snow Stride

Zebub (PFS).description:
Zebubs serve as Hell's messengers and spies. Their ability to share what they've seen with other creatures makes them especially useful-not only to other devils, but also to mortal conjurers. Some infernal lords unleash them in enormous, horrid swarms upon unsuspecting lands to debase flesh and land alike while collecting secrets the infernal host might later put to use. Zebubs use any opportunity to manipulate weak-willed or easily tempted mortals into serving the zebubs' whims. While arrogant and deceitful, zebubs lack the cunning and confidence of most devils, and thus their schemes often focus on satisfying self-serving or self-destructive ambitions. Zebubs form from the souls of childish and craven mortals, reshaped by the archdevil Baalzebul in the frozen, filthy wastes of Hell's seventh layer, Cocytus.

Each type of devil plays a particular role in Hell's bureaucracies and hierarchies, though some have far more specialized functions than others.

BkBEhqLM3mXNI13M.description:
Opening a door that bypasses normal space, you instantly transport yourself and any items you're wearing and holding from your current space to a clear space within range you can see. If this would bring another creature with you-even if you're carrying it in an extradimensional container-the spell is lost.

Heightened (5th) The range increases to 1 mile. You don't need to be able to see your destination, as long as you have been there in the past and know its relative location and distance from you. You are temporarily immune for 1 hour.
BkBEhqLM3mXNI13M.name: Dimension Door (At Will)

JLbHt0LM9WGhFhGj.description:
You conjure an animal to fight for you. You summon a common creature that has the animal trait and whose level is -1, such as those found in Pathfinder Bestiary volumes. Heightening the spell increases the maximum level of creature you can summon.

Heightened (2nd) Level 1

Heightened (3rd) Level 2

Heightened (4th) Level 3

Heightened (5th) Level 5

Heightened (6th) Level 7

Heightened (7th) Level 9

Heightened (8th) Level 11

Heightened (9th) Level 13

Heightened (10th) Level 15
JLbHt0LM9WGhFhGj.name: Summon Animal (Swarm creatures only)

LNbjPm5a6CTl4lko.description:
The zebub records everything they see, and though they don't remember all observations, they can pass them along to another creature.

The zebub replays 10 minutes of witnessed events to a touched willing creature, which receives the memories in a flash of information. By remaining in contact, the zebub can spend additional 3-action activities to replay more information.

After relaying their visions to another, the zebub can't ever recall those events again.
LNbjPm5a6CTl4lko.name: Infernal Eye

N8ZU33hWaqrMOe87.description:
You make an appeal to a powerful devil, asking it to bind some of its subordinates to your service. If you succeed, the devil sends you its choice of one devil whose level is no more than double infernal pact's rank, two devils whose levels are each at least 2 less than double the spell rank, or three devils whose levels are each at least 3 less than double the spell rank.

Critical Success The devils are sent to you and serve you for [[/r 1d4 #weeks]]{1d4 weeks}.

Success The devils are sent to you and serve you for [[/r 1d4 #days]]{1d4 days}.

Failure Your request is denied.

Critical Failure Not only is your request denied, but the powerful devil sends word of its displeasure to your master.
N8ZU33hWaqrMOe87.name: Infernal Pact

QZup3O3zcKH6TFZd.description: The zebub's Strikes deal an additional 1d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.
QZup3O3zcKH6TFZd.name: Sneak Attack

VHrffK2iT75MwXoK.description:
You mouth words quietly, but instead of coming out of your mouth, they're transferred directly to the ears of the target. While others can't hear your words any better than if you normally mouthed them, the target can hear your words as if they were standing next to you.

The target can give a brief response as a reaction, or as a free action on their next turn if they wish, but they must be able to see you and be within range to do so. If they respond, their response is delivered directly to your ear, just like the original message.

Heightened (3rd) The spell's range increases to 500 feet.
VHrffK2iT75MwXoK.name: Message

lQzCQf7gDhv2S88W.description:
Cloaked in illusion, the target becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.zJxUflt9np0q4yML]{Invisible}. This makes it @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VRSef5y1LmL2Hkjf]{Undetected} to all creatures, though the creatures can attempt to find the target, making it @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden} to them instead. If the target uses a hostile action, the spell ends after that hostile action is completed.

Heightened (4th) The spell lasts 1 minute, but it doesn't end if the target uses a hostile action.
lQzCQf7gDhv2S88W.name: Invisibility (At Will) (Self Only)

pp1yszjrLBogZB6a.description:
Opening a door that bypasses normal space, you instantly transport yourself and any items you're wearing and holding from your current space to a clear space within range you can see. If this would bring another creature with you-even if you're carrying it in an extradimensional container-the spell is lost.

Heightened (5th) The range increases to 1 mile. You don't need to be able to see your destination, as long as you have been there in the past and know its relative location and distance from you. You are temporarily immune for 1 hour.
pp1yszjrLBogZB6a.name: Dimension Door

Zebub (PFS).name: Zebub (PFS)
Zebub (PFS).npcAllSaves: +1 status to all saves vs. magic
